PublishedCohortLibraryGetAll.demographicsText: All those aged 5 years or older in the clinical risk groups shown in Tables 3 and 4 of the Green Book.
PublishedCohortLibraryGetAll.description: The autumn booster is being offered to those at high risk of the complications of COVID-19 infection. The booster should help to reduce their risk of being admitted to hospital with COVID-19.
PublishedCohortLibraryGetAll.disclaimerText: The information provided outlines CaaS's approach to delivering this cohort using established methodologies. It highlights any differences from the clinical criteria in the Green Book, chapter 14a and associated assumptions.
PublishedCohortLibraryGetAll.name: COVID-19 autumn booster vaccinations 2022 to 2023
PublishedCohortLibraryGetAll.summary:
NHS England commissioned Cohort as a Service (CaaS) to identify people that were eligible for the autumn 2022 to 2023 COVID-19 booster vaccination.
To be eligible, they needed to be:
- children aged 5 to 15 years
- adults aged 16 years and over
- in defined clinical risk groups shown in tables 3 and 4 of the [Green Book, chapter 14a]( https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/covid-19-the-green-book-chapter-14a)
CaaS developed specific rules based on the conditions in the Green Book and used clinical data to identify people who met the rules.
The data collected helped to:
- contact or remind people to receive their COVID autumn booster
- focus protection on those at clinical risk of COVID-19
- report and monitor on the 2022 to 2023 autumn booster campaign

PublishedCohortLibraryGetAll.name: Flu vaccinations 2022 to 2023
PublishedCohortLibraryGetAll.summary:
NHS England commissioned Cohorting as a Service (CaaS) to identify people that were eligible for the 2022 to 2023 winter flu vaccination.
To be eligible, they needed to be:
- 6 months of age or older
- in defined clinical risk groups shown in the [Green Book, chapter 19](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/influenza-the-green-book-chapter-19)
CaaS developed specific rules based on the conditions in the Green Book and used clinical data to identify people who met those rules.
The data collected helped to:
- contact or remind people to receive their flu vaccination between 1 September 2022 and 31 March 2023
- focus protection on those at a clinical risk of flu
- monitor the number of people who received the flu vaccination
